file_content.text: Enough. I should have settled this with sabacc.
So, Captain, what will it take for me to walk out of here? I know you always have your price.
What are you offering?
Try me.
Give me what I need to take down the Senator, and maybe you'll live.
Give up Dodonna.
Sold. She's no good to the Voidwolf once the Senate repudiates her.
It was so easy to turn her. The promise of a little power of her own... she signed on the dotted line.
How did a gambler and dilettante end up working for the Empire?
Who are you really?
Do not confuse me with the pose I was forced to take. I'm a citizen of the Empire and agent of Imperial Intelligence.
It will be a relief to return to a part of the galaxy where men are ruled by more than their immediate desires.
Make me an offer I like, and maybe you'll still get back there.
What's your freedom worth?
Dodonna's who the Republic really wants. My dossier-- complete records of my time as her handler.
You're not going anywhere but the deepest Republic prison.
You're under arrest.
Oh, but you were there already, weren't you? It's in ruins. The Republic is too soft to kill its enemies; you let them eat you alive.
I know your price. It's Dodonna the Republic really wants.
You're too dangerous to leave alive.
I'm going to kill you.
Has it been a lie since the day we met?
Who are you really?
It's hard to believe you fell for what I showed you--a soft nobody who gambled away his life in cantinas.
You were easy enough to convince. The hardest part was hiding my disgust.
You're too smart to waste your talents serving nothing but your own greed.
What a waste-- serving a Republic that can't even earn the loyalty of its elected rulers.
You're a sniveling Imperial today! Don't pretend you care.
You used me!
You made me laugh. When I was with you, it felt like there was more to my life than blasters and credits.
I loved you!
You surprised me. I thought... "Corso Riggs... this will be some no-name brainless little merc just like him."
Hey!
You're not the first woman I've lied to for the Empire, but you're the first who ever made me regret it.
I wish I could just pull the trigger. Give me a reason to justify sparing your life.
Convince me not to kill you.
That's a mistake. He'll run straight to the Voidwolf.
Not again! What does it take for you to see he's betrayed you?
Don't be a fool!
I know his kind, Captain. His loyalty will always be to the Empire.
Whoa whoa whoa. Why don't you leave this part up to me?
Give me one reason I should let you live.
You're a dead man.
Not this time, Darmas. We're past bargaining.
You're a dead man.
It's Dodonna you want. The Republic doesn't care about a spy in its cantinas, but the Senate...?
I'm the one who convinced her to spare your life. Let me go, and I'll give you this to throw to the Republic.
My dossier-- the complete record of Dodonna's treason from the day I recruited her.
I'll tell Master Sumalee that I killed you and took the dossier. You can hide on my ship.
Come away with me.
Over my dead body!
I don't get it. Has he brainwashed you? He's a traitor! An Imperial spy!
No!
You might as well invite the Voidwolf into your bed.
Okay, when you forgave me and let me join your crew, that was kind of sweet, but this is going too far.
My loyalty is to the Empire, sweetheart. Don't give me another chance to break your heart.
Take the dossier. And if you're ever back on Port Nowhere, here's a code for my locker.
Call what's inside my apology.
I don't know if I should kiss you or kill you... but you belong to the Republic now.
I'll visit you in jail.
I guess you'll cheat them in every way except the one that counts.
If I'd have pegged you for such a patriot, I'd never have told Dodonna your name.
We made quite a team, Captain. Too bad you're on the wrong side.
No man gets away with betraying me.
You're dead. [Kill him]
Spare me, and I'll give you my whole dossier on Dodonna. Everything from the day I recruited her.
It was easy, you know. One offer of power she wouldn't have to share with a thousand scrabbling Senators... she couldn't wait to sign up.
Sweeten the pot enough, and I'll let you walk out of here alive.
What's in it for me?
Bad move, Captain. Don't leave a man like that at your back.
Uh-uh, Captain. I steered you wrong once with Darmas. Don't trust him again.
No price is enough.
Don't trust him, Captain. The Empire doesn't like loose ends.
If I were in your shoes, Captain, that'd have to be one seriously impressive bribe.
Dodonna's not enough? Fine, then.
I'll give you a code to one of the lockers on Port Nowhere. You'll find something in there to make it worth your while.
I knew you'd have a price.
I'll take the dossier... and your testimony at Dodonna's trial.
You're going to the Republic.
A good citizen to the end, hmm? I thought I cured you of that.
Fine. It won't be the first Republic prison I've escaped from.
Nothing makes up for the way you used me.
No deal. [Kill him]
Ahh!
Once the docs change my face, I'll be dropping out of sight. I'm no good to the Empire if that idiot captain's got the whole Republic chasing me.
I can take your place with the Voidwolf! Anything he needs....
Your face is known, too, Caicos. A Corellian councillor isn't much use in bringing in underworld allies.
I brought him Corellia!
A pleasure to make your acquaintance, Mister Soon-to-be-hunted-down-by-his-own-constituents.
Hello, Councillor Idiot.
Corellia belongs to the Republic!
Not if I can help it.
You just don't give up, do you, Captain?
Is that...? Alert! Alert! Break-in at the factory. Send backup now!
Don't kill me!
Just don't get in my way.
No promises.
I don't kill innocents. Even innocent Imperials.
Get out of here.
We'll just be going, then....
You work for the Empire, you deserve what you get.
You die, too. [Kill them]
No! Please!
You caught me again. Too bad.
And I was wondering what face to take to win your heart again. Since the first time was so easy.
Just as I was choosing the perfect face to win your heart this time.
I was thinking it might be fun to take your face... and take over the criminal empire we've built.
But I guess I'll have to kill you instead.
This ends here, Darmas!
Game's up! [Attack Darmas]
Off the link, Caicos. Send backup....
Corellia will not fall!
When we blow this tunnel, we'll pour down on the Empire like an erupting volcano! We....
Her! The Imperial traitor! Shall we bow to the Voidwolf with her? Or teach her what real Corellians do?
Him! The Imperial traitor! Will we let him sell Corellia to the Voidwolf? Or teach him how wrong he is?
Traitor!
You're dead!
Nobody turns against Corellia!
Why are you lying to them? I've been the only one defending you!
How can you say that?
I'm not sure if I'm touched by your trust, or insulted that you believed I was that self-indulgent sluggard.
Why does everyone always believe the worst of me?
Not again....
Do you need to ask?
I've been trying to figure that out. I think it's got something to do with the hair.
Ha.
Have you done anything to dissuade them?
This isn't the worst. Now if they found out you've been accidentally working for the Voidwolf all this time....
Because so often it's true.
I'm a loyal citizen of the Republic! Mostly.
He's lying! I'm no traitor!
Darmas is an agent of the Voidwolf!
He's the Imperial!
They're not going to listen, sweetheart. Though that look of outrage is really quite fetching.
They won't believe you.
I already told them how you stole Balmorran weapons and White Maw cloaking technology for the Voidwolf.
Oh. Okay, it's the worst.
Many of them were quite offended by such behavior from someone on a Senator's payroll.
String her up!
So nothing we said, nothing we did... meant anything?
I thought you loved me!
You think a few nights in your bed can weigh against the glory of the Empire?
Blast him to pieces!
No one makes a fool of me and lives!
You die now! [Attack Darmas]
He's the one who tricked me into helping the Empire. Just like he's trying to trick you!
Darmas serves the Voidwolf!
This whole patriot thing is a sham! He's just in it for the hot lady rebels!
[Lie] Darmas wants your women!
Getting desperate, are we?
Obviously the lie of a woman scorned.
I admit, I once loved this woman. Until I heard her speak oaths to the Voidwolf in her sleep!
Just for the record, I never trusted you.
How dare you! [Attack Darmas]
Kill this man before he calls the Empire down on you!
That's your last lie!
Traitor! [Attack Darmas]
He's using you, just like he used me... don't let yourself be fooled as long as I was.
He's lying.
Do you think they'll believe you were blind enough to serve the Voidwolf for so long without question?
Balmorra, Hoth, Voss, Belsavis... I can't think of anyone who's helped him more....
Either I'm a greater mastermind than anyone would credit, or you are seriously dumber than you look.
The Voidwolf has agents everywhere, even the Senate. We have to stop him... starting right here.
I was tricked.
What does the Senate have to do with Corellia? This is our planet... our fight!
Who here knows this man? Is he a true son of Corellia? Who vouches for him?
I've never seen him before.
I thought you knew him!
We've been tricked! Here, help us hold the tunnel! Don't let the Empire in...!
No, seriously! He's kidnapping women from across the galaxy for his shipboard harem! Last night, I saw him with a young Drall girl....
Darmas is a sleazy predator.
Don't be ridiculous...!
It's true! He tried to lure me onto his ship last night to see his "rare artworks."
He was flirting with my daughter!
Where's Leelee? Where did you take her, you monster?
Take this. Help us get him!
Code 11! Code 11! I'm under attack. Send backup!
If you open that tunnel, you give the Empire a path right to you.
The Empire will kill you all.
A path right to them! Will we cower here, or fight to the end?
Hey, wasn't this whole thing his idea...?
It was the Republic forces who sealed off this tunnel!
You're too late! Now we add another jewel of the Republic to our crown!
Get back!
Ahh!
Darmas betrayed us! We're lost!
Ahh!
You're dead. [Kill him]
No deal. [Kill him]
